\chapter{README}
\label{\detokenize{index:readme}}

\section{Mitsuba Rendering from Unreal Engine Export}
\label{\detokenize{index:mitsuba-rendering-from-unreal-engine-export}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This project allows you to:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Export light positions from a \sphinxstylestrong{Blender} scene (originally imported from Unreal Engine).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Render the 3D scene with \sphinxstylestrong{Mitsuba 3} using those lights.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Save the results as \sphinxstylestrong{PNG images} and \sphinxstylestrong{compressed HDF5} files.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Visualize all the rendered images easily.

\end{itemize}


\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{index:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This project was developed in Python 3.12, the compatibility with other versions cannot be guaranteed.

\sphinxAtStartPar
To install a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{requirements.txt}} is provided and the modules can be installed by

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}r\PYG{+w}{ }requirements.txt
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Use}
\label{\detokenize{index:use}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The use of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{mitsuba\_render\_h5.py}} is relatively straightforward and also illustrated in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{demo.ipynb}}:

\sphinxAtStartPar
One can either run

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{src}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{mitsuba\PYGZus{}render\PYGZus{}h5}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{render\PYGZus{}scene}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
in another Python file or run \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{mitsuba\_render\_h5.py}} in the command line by running e.g.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }src/mitsuba\PYGZus{}render\PYGZus{}h5.py\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}scene\PYGZus{}dir\PYG{+w}{ }demo\PYGZus{}scene\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}out\PYGZus{}path\PYG{+w}{ }demo\PYGZus{}scene
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
with the current working directory as defaults for the arguments \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}scene\_dir}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}out\_file}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This will save the rendered png files, as well as the combined HDF5 file in the out\_path directory
